intro: Tamonea curassavica, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer and early fall. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Tamonea curassavica is typically found growing in moist, shady areas such as forests and along stream banks.
